title: Tailoring Poetry Instruction to Student Needs

questions.question: What are the three main categories of learning styles mentioned in the module?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of visual learners?
What is a recommended strategy for teaching poetry to auditory learners?
choices: Use graphic organizers for poem structure
Incorporate visual art in poetry lessons

questions.question: Which strategy is particularly effective for kinesthetic learners?
What is differentiation in the context of poetry instruction?
choices: Tailoring instruction to meet individual students' needs
questions.answer: Tailoring instruction to meet individual students' needs

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the key aspects of differentiation mentioned in the module?
What is scaffolding in poetry instruction?
choices: Building physical structures for poetry performances
Providing temporary support to help students achieve a learning goal
Creating a hierarchy of poetic forms
questions.answer: Providing temporary support to help students achieve a learning goal

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of scaffolding in poetry instruction?
choices: Giving all students the same complex poem
Providing sentence starters for poem lines
Focusing only on free verse poetry
Assigning the same writing task to all students
questions.answer: Providing sentence starters for poem lines

questions.question: What is a recommended strategy for beginner-level poetry instruction?
choices: Focus on simple format poems like acrostics
questions.answer: Focus on simple format poems like acrostics

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a factor to consider when assessing student abilities in poetry?
What is an effective method for assessing student readiness for poetry writing?
Which of the following is an example of differentiating content in poetry instruction?
choices: Using the same poem for all students
Focusing only on one poetic form
Assigning the same writing task to all students

questions.question: What is an example of differentiating process in poetry instruction?
choices: Providing the same instructions to all students
Assigning the same homework to everyone

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of differentiating product in poetry instruction?
choices: Requiring all students to write a sonnet
Offering multiple ways to present poems
Grading all poems using the same rubric
questions.answer: Offering multiple ways to present poems

questions.question: What is the purpose of using word banks in poetry instruction?
Which poetic form is suggested as appropriate for beginner-level students?
What is recommended for advanced-level poetry instruction?
choices: Explore experimental forms and free verse
questions.answer: Explore experimental forms and free verse

questions.question: How can technology support differentiated poetry instruction?
choices: By eliminating the need for writing
By focusing only on digital poetry

questions.question: What is the benefit of offering choice in poetry topics or formats?
choices: It increases student engagement and motivation
It ensures all students write the same type of poem
questions.answer: It increases student engagement and motivation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way to make poetry accessible to struggling readers?
What is the purpose of using graphic organizers in poetry instruction?
choices: To help students visualize poem structure and themes
To eliminate the need for writing
questions.answer: To help students visualize poem structure and themes

questions.question: Which activity is suggested to benefit kinesthetic learners in poetry instruction?
choices: Creating tableaux vivants to represent scenes from poems
questions.answer: Creating tableaux vivants to represent scenes from poems

questions.question: What is the gradual release of responsibility model in scaffolding?
choices: Giving students full responsibility from the start
Never allowing students to work independently
Gradually removing support as students gain skills and confidence
Maintaining the same level of support throughout the learning process
questions.answer: Gradually removing support as students gain skills and confidence

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way to incorporate movement in poetry instruction?
choices: Choreographing movements to accompany spoken word

questions.question: What is the benefit of using multilingual resources in poetry instruction?
choices: It supports language learners and promotes inclusivity
It reduces the focus on poetry
questions.answer: It supports language learners and promotes inclusivity

questions.question: Which assessment method is suggested as an alternative to written tests in poetry instruction?
What is the purpose of using templates in scaffolded poetry instruction?
choices: To provide structure for specific poem forms
To make all poems look the same
questions.answer: To provide structure for specific poem forms

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a benefit of tailoring poetry instruction to student needs?
What is the recommended approach for teaching traditional Timorese poetic forms?
choices: Ignore them in favor of international forms
Teach them only to advanced students
Develop strategies specific to local forms
questions.answer: Develop strategies specific to local forms

questions.question: How can cultural background influence a student's approach to poetry?
choices: It has no impact on poetry learning
It can influence learning style and poetic preferences
It should be ignored in poetry instruction
questions.answer: It can influence learning style and poetic preferences
